About [the Author

Mack]104-mack

One morning . That ’s all [I]0-i wanted . One morning to [myself]0-i . To sleep in . To sleep naked . To sleep with [my]0-i bedroom door closed . To wake up when [I]0-i felt like it . To wake up and hear nothing . To wake up and do whatever the hell [I]0-i felt like doing that morning — take a run or jerk off or go the fuck back to sleep . “ [Daddy]48-daddy ! Get up ! ”[0-i] This was not that morning . Groaning , [I]0-i rolled over onto [my]0-i stomach and held [my]0-i pillow over the back of [my]0-i head . “ [Daddy]48-daddy ’s not [here]1783-here , ”[0-i] [I]0-i said , [my]0-i voice muffled . [I]0-i heard giggling , then felt the mattress shift as [one or more of [[my]0-i three daughters]160-my three daughters]159-one or more of my three daughters jumped onto [my]0-i bed . Frankly , it was kind of surprising [none of [them]160-my three daughters]156-none of them had been [here]1783-here already . For months after [[their]160-my three daughters mother]163-their mother left , [I]0-i had n’t had [[my]0-i bed]164-my bed to [myself]0-i . Sometimes it was eleven - year - old [Millie]49-millie with a stomachache . Sometimes eight - year - old [Felicity]50-felicity with nightmares . Often it was four - year - [old Winifred]51-winnie hiding from the monster beneath [her]51-winnie bed . Occasionally it was [all three]165-all three . [We]165-all three want pancakes . ”[0-i] [I]0-i sighed . “ Ca n’t [she]49-millie make pancakes ? ”[0-i] “ [She]49-millie does n’t know how to use the stove . Goddamn , it was only the beginning of February — Groundhog Day . And it was cloudy , which meant spring was supposed to come early ( according to the lore ) , but right now it felt like spring was never going to get here . [Frannie]104-mack

[I]0-i made sure that [Mack]104-mack talked it over with [the girls]173-the girls when [I]0-i was n’t around , and [he]104-mack assured [me]0-i that [they]173-the girls were completely enthusiastic about the idea . “ Not only are [you]0-i a much better cook than [me]104-mack , but [you]0-i know how to do all kinds of braids , [you]0-i smell better , and [you]0-i ’re much more patient . ”[104-mack] “ And [you]104-mack ’re sure it ’s what [you]104-mack want ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i asked , standing beside [him]104-mack as [we]1706-we loaded the dishwasher after dinner one Friday night . In [the living room]217-the living room , [we]1706-we could hear [the kids]259-the kids arguing about whose turn it was to choose the movie . It was [our]1706-we typical weekend evening , and maybe [some girls [my]0-i age]1713-some girls my age would have found it boring , but [I]0-i ’d never been happier . [Our]1706-we relationship was n’t perfect — [we]1706-we had misunderstandings like [any other couple]1714-any other couple , times where [we]1706-we took [one another]1707-one another for granted , times when dealing with [[his]104-mack ex]1716-his ex or [our]1706-we work schedules or bickering kids made [us]1706-we short with [one another]1707-one another — but [we]1706-we were always quick to apologize , and every time [we]1706-we kissed and made up , [we]1706-we felt closer than before . Life was n’t easy , but it was beautiful . “ Are [you]0-i kidding ? ”[104-mack] Wiping [his]104-mack wet hands on a towel , [he]104-mack turned to [me]0-i and took [me]0-i in [his]104-mack arms . “ Of course it ’s what [I]104-mack want . [This house]189-this house would n’t even feel like [home]304-home without [you]0-i anymore . [You]0-i belong here . ”[104-mack] [I]0-i smiled up at [him]104-mack . “ [I]104-mack used to dream of hearing [you]104-mack say that to [me]104-mack . ”[104-mack] “ Then tell [me]104-mack [you]0-i ’ll stay . ”[104-mack] Twining [my]0-i arms around [his]104-mack waist , [I]0-i pressed [my]0-i cheek to [his]104-mack chest , feeling like [his]104-mack embrace was the only home [I]0-i ’d ever need . “ [I]104-mack ’ll stay . ”[104-mack]

Epilogue

For [my]0-i birthday that summer , [he]104-mack took [me]0-i to [Paris]30-paris . [He]104-mack arranged everything — brought [[his]104-mack parents]1718-his parents in to stay with [the kids]259-the kids for a week , talked to [April]59-april and [Natalie]112-natalie to make sure [I]0-i could get the time off , told [me]0-i to pack [my]0-i bags for a week away — and promised to tell [me]0-i where [we]1720-we were going when [we]1720-we got to [the airport]1721-the airport . “ What ? How am [I]0-i supposed to pack ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i shrieked . [He]104-mack had no sympathy . “ Pack for an elegant destination . Not [the beach]2328-the beach . Not [the mountains]2857-the mountains . Not [the desert]2858-the desert . That ’s all [I]173-the girls ’m saying . ”[173-the girls] [The girls]173-the girls , who knew where [we]1720-we were going but were sworn to secrecy , came into [the bedroom]724-the bedroom to watch [me]0-i pack , giggling and shushing [each other]1873-each other . [My]0-i only clue came when [we]1720-we hugged and kissed [them]173-the girls goodbye , and [Felicity]50-felicity shouted , “ Bon voyage ! ”[50-felicity] and [Millie]49-millie elbowed [her]50-felicity . “ Do n’t ruin it ! ”[49-millie] “ [I]1726-you did n’t ! That ’s what [you]1726-you say when [someone]207-someone goes on a trip , even if [they]207-someone ’re not going to [France]29-france ! ”[1726-you] On the way to [the airport]1721-the airport , [he]1726-you finally told [me]0-i [we]1720-we were flying to [Paris]30-paris , and [I]0-i flipped out . “ Oh [my]1726-you God ! Do [you]1726-you have [my]1726-you passport ? ”[1726-you] “ Of course [I]0-i do . ”[0-i] [I]0-i touched the corners of [my]0-i eyes and fanned [my]0-i face . “ This is too much . It ’s just a birthday . ”[0-i] “ It ’s not . It ’s a chance for [me]0-i to do something for [you]1726-you and show [you]1726-you how much [I]0-i appreciate all [you]1726-you do for [me]0-i . And it was time for [you]1726-you to get a stamp in that passport already . ”[0-i] [I]0-i laughed . “ [I]0-i ca n’t believe this . Pinch [me]0-i ! ”[0-i] “ [I]1727-he ’d be happy to , but [you]0-i ’re not going to wake up . ”[1727-he] [He]1727-he took [my]0-i hand and kissed the back of it . “ This is real life . ”[1727-he] It might have been , but not a moment passed that it did n’t seem like a dream . [We]1728-we stayed at [a cozy little place on [the Left Bank]38-the left bank]1729-a cozy little place on the left bank , wandered [cobblestone streets]1730-cobblestone streets hand in hand , drank coffee and ate pastries every morning in [a different café]1731-a different café , hit [all the touristy spots]1732-all the touristy spots and took a million pictures to send to [the kids]259-the kids . [We]1728-we lingered over bottles of wine at dinner every evening , and spent all night long in [each other]1873-each other ’s arms without worrying about how loud [we]1728-we were , how naked [we]1728-we were , or how many [people]290-people were sleeping above [us]1728-we . It was heaven . Then one morning , [Mack]104-mack told [me]0-i to pack [my]0-i bags because the last couple nights of the trip would be spent somewhere else . Excited and intrigued , [I]0-i did what [he]1727-he said . A few hours later , [we]1728-we emerged from [a train]1736-a train in [Tours]39-tours and rented [a car]1737-a car . As soon as [I]0-i saw the signs for [the Loire]40-the loire , [I]0-i knew where [we]1728-we were heading . “ [Mack]104-mack . ”[0-i] [I]0-i grabbed [his]1727-he arm . “ No way . [You]1727-he did n’t . ”[0-i] [He]1727-he just laughed and kept driving , and in less than an hour , [I]0-i saw it come into view — [Le Château d’Ussé]41-le château d’ussé , looking every bit as magical as the fairy tale castle [I]0-i ’d imagined as [a girl]2572-a girl . [I]0-i felt like [I]0-i was walking on a cloud all day long . [We]1728-we toured [the castle]1090-the castle and [grounds]1740-grounds from one end to the other — [the dungeons]1741-the dungeons , [the salons]1742-the salons , [the grand halls]1743-the grand halls , the spiral staircases , [the stables]1744-the stables , [the chapel]1745-the chapel . [We]1728-we learned about [the medieval kings and [queens who ’d walked the stone floors]1747-queens who ’d walked the stone floors]1746-the medieval kings and queens who ’d walked the stone floors , the Renaissance works of art on the walls , and of course , the inspiration of [Perrault]127-perrault ’s Sleeping Beauty . [We]1728-we walked to [a nearby café]1748-a nearby café for lunch and returned to [the château]1749-the château to stroll along gravel paths in [the gardens]1750-the gardens and kiss beneath the shade of cedar trees . It was while [we]1728-we were in [the gardens]1750-the gardens that [Mack]104-mack turned to [me]0-i and took [my]0-i hands . “ So ? Is it everything [you]0-i expected ? ”[104-mack] [I]0-i nodded happily . “ More . [I]0-i ’m only sorry [the kids]259-the kids are n’t [here]1783-here . [They]259-the kids ’d love this ! ”[0-i] “ [We]1728-we ’ll bring [them]259-the kids back someday . How about that ? ”[104-mack] “ Do [you]104-mack think [we]1728-we ’ll come back ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i asked wistfully , glancing at the château behind [us]1728-we , looking even more beautiful and enchanting in the fading sunlight . “ Of course [I]0-i do . [We]1728-we ’ll want to show [them]259-the kids exactly where [we]1728-we were when [I]0-i asked [you]0-i to marry [me]0-i . ”[0-i] [I]0-i stared at [him]1752-i . “ What ? ”[0-i] [He]1752-i smiled , reaching into [his]1752-i pocket and pulling out a ring . “ The box would n’t fit in [my]1752-i pocket , ”[1752-i] [he]1752-i said sheepishly . “ [I]1752-i did n’t plan that part very well . Which brings [me]1752-i to [my]1752-i next point . ”[1752-i] [He]1752-i took a breath . “ [I]1752-i ’m [no prince]2862-no prince , [Frannie]104-mack . [I]1752-i ’m stubborn , [I]1752-i ’m impatient , [I]1752-i have a foul mouth and a lot of fucking baggage . And [I]1752-i come attached to [three small humans who run [me]1752-i ragged every day]2863-three small humans who run me ragged every day . But [I]1752-i love [you]104-mack more than [I]1752-i ’ve ever loved [anyone]178-anyone . ”[1752-i] “ [I]0-i love [you]104-mack , too . ”[0-i] [I]0-i ’d started to cry , and [he]1752-i gently brushed tears from beneath [my]0-i eyes with one thumb before taking [my]0-i left hand and sliding the ring , a simple diamond solitaire on a delicate platinum band , onto [my]0-i fourth finger . “ Then [I]1752-i have a question for [you]104-mack . ”[1752-i] [He]1752-i got down on one knee , keeping [my]0-i hand in [his]1752-i . “ [I]1752-i ca n’t promise to build [you]104-mack [a castle like this]2865-a castle like this , or take [you]104-mack to [Paris]30-paris every year , or even clean up [my]1752-i mouth . But [I]1752-i can promise to spend every day of [my]1752-i life , and every night , treating [you]104-mack like [a fucking queen]2866-a fucking queen — [I’m]1752-i sorry . ”[1752-i] [He]1752-i looked nervous . “ [A regular queen]2867-a regular queen . [Jesus Christ]82-jesus , [I]1752-i ca n’t even propose without cursing . ”[1752-i] [I]0-i laughed , sniffling through [my]0-i tears . “ It ’s okay . [I]0-i know exactly who [you]1752-i are , and [I]0-i would n’t change [you]1752-i for anything . ”[0-i] “ Does that mean [you]1752-i ’ll marry [me]0-i ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i nodded , fresh tears cascading down [my]0-i cheeks . “ Yes . [I]1752-i ’ll marry [you]1752-i . ”[1752-i] [He]1752-i stood up and [we]1753-we threw [our]1753-we arms around [each other]1873-each other , and the ground fell away beneath [my]0-i feet . “ [God]62-god , [I]1752-i ’m so glad that ’s done , ”[1752-i] [he]1752-i admitted . “ Why ? Did [you]1752-i think [I]1752-i ’d say no ? ”[1752-i] “ Not really , [I]1752-i was just afraid [I]1752-i ’d fuck it up somehow . Lose the ring , forget what [I]1752-i wanted to say , screw up the directions to get here . There was a lot depending on [my]1752-i ability to get things right , and [I]1752-i do n’t always trust [myself]1752-i . ”[1752-i] “ Well , [you]0-i should . [You]0-i did it perfectly . ”[1752-i] [My]0-i toes touched the ground , but [I]0-i hardly felt it . “ [I]0-i could n’t be happier . ”[0-i] “ Good . ”[1752-i] [He]1752-i kissed [my]0-i lips . “ Now [we]2868-we should call [home]304-home , because [I]0-i told [the girls]173-the girls [they]173-the girls could stay up until [you]1752-i said yes . ”[0-i] [I]0-i squealed . “ [They]173-the girls knew ? ”[0-i] “ Only after [we]2868-we left . [I]0-i did n’t trust [them]173-the girls to keep the secret , so [I]0-i called [them]173-the girls while [you]1752-i were in the shower yesterday and told [them]173-the girls it was happening . But [they]173-the girls ’ve known for a while [I]0-i wanted to ask . And [Millie]49-millie helped [me]0-i choose the ring . ”[0-i] “ [She]49-millie did ? ”[0-i] [I]0-i felt choked up all over again . “ Mmhm . [Millie]49-millie and [April]59-april . ”[0-i] [I]0-i sighed . “ [We]2868-we ’re so lucky to have [family]325-family like [we]2868-we do . ”[0-i] “ [We]2868-we are . And maybe [we]2868-we can even add to it . ”[0-i] Leaning back , [I]0-i looked at [him]1755-i in surprise . “ Did [I]1755-i hear that right ? ”[1755-i] [He]1755-i shrugged . “ [I]1755-i figure [I]1755-i ’m not that old . Might be fun to give [the girls]173-the girls [a little brother]2873-a little brother . ”[1755-i] “ Or [sister]2874-sister . ”[1755-i] [He]1755-i paused . “ Um … [a house with [four girls]2876-four girls in [it]2875-a house with four girls in it]2875-a house with four girls in it ? ”[1755-i] Giggling , [I]0-i kissed [his]1755-i lips . “ Five . Do n’t forget [[your]1755-i wife]2877-your wife . ”[0-i] [He]1755-i sighed . “ [We]2878-we ’re going to need more space . And [I]1755-i ’m going to need a bigger swear jar . ”[1755-i] “ Relax , [babe]2879-babe . It ’s gon na be okay . [I]1755-i ’ve got [you]2879-babe . ”[1755-i] “ [We]2878-we ’ve got [each other]1873-each other . ”[1755-i] [He]1755-i pulled [me]0-i close again , burying [his]1755-i face in [my]0-i hair . “ And it ’s only going to get better . ”[1755-i]

The End

About the Author

[Melanie Harlow]43-melanie harlow likes [her]43-melanie harlow heels high , [her]43-melanie harlow martini dry , and [her]43-melanie harlow history with the naughty bits left in . In addition to IRRESISTIBLE , [she]43-melanie harlow ’s [the author of the One and Only Series]1777-the author of the one and only series , the After [We]1778-we Fall Series , the Happy Crazy Love Series , the Frenched Series , HOLD [YOU]1776-you CLOSE , ( co - authored with [Corinne Michaels]129-corinne michaels ) , STRONG ENOUGH ( a M / M romance co - authored with [David Romanov]130-david romanov ) , and The Speak Easy Duet ( a historical romance set in the 1920s ) . [She]43-melanie harlow writes from [[her]43-melanie harlow home outside of [Detroit]21-detroit]1779-her home outside of detroit , where [she]43-melanie harlow lives with [[her]43-melanie harlow husband]292-her husband and [two daughters]1781-two daughters . When [she]43-melanie harlow ’s not writing , [she]43-melanie harlow ’s probably got a cocktail in hand . And sometimes when [she]43-melanie harlow is .

Find [her]43-melanie harlow at www.melanieharlow.com .

If [she]43-melanie harlow ’s not [there]1788-there , try [The Sugar House]42-the sugar house .
